Text: Happy #PresidentsDay! Today we celebrate the birthday of one of our nation’s Founding Fathers, George Washington, and honor all of those who followed in his footsteps by serving as President of this great country. https://t.co/uXX1g4C5Le

Pleased that Congress has passed a CR through March 11, ensuring the govt will remain open as we continue our bipartisan, bicameral negotiations on FY22 bills. We're making progress under our omnibus framework, but there’s still a lot of work to be done. https://t.co/467j1mz6q2
Please stay safe and take all necessary precautions given the severe weather conditions. #alwx https://t.co/CGs2hNrbe5

Today I spoke on the Senate floor about a vital member of my staff, Shannon Hines. In her 27 yrs on Capitol Hill, she's served in many important roles, including as the first female staff director of the Senate Appropriations Cmte. I wish her all the best. https://t.co/X6CmFMM0BX
Great showing of resiliency here from the Yellowhammer state! https://t.co/3U6sWDRX1T

I led the AL delegation in a letter to the STB as it considers mandating passenger service on the Gulf Coast – which, without the necessary data & infrastructure improvements, threatens to significantly impact Mobile’s Port & related freight rail traffic. https://t.co/wDz7R7ACON

Mohammed Qazi, Associate Dean for Research & Outreach at @TuskegeeUniv, received a Presidential Award for his exceptional mentorship and hard work in the #STEM field. Dr. Qazi has won several @NSF grants and is known for going above and beyond to help enhance STEM participation. https://t.co/mrM9LxwIbp

Congratulations to @UAHuntsville on earning the highest research activity rating in the recent update of the Carnegie Classification of Institutes of Higher Ed. Their "R1" rank is a testament to current staff and students, and is excellent news for the future of research at UAH. https://t.co/2fESbGOa5L

Congratulations to @AuburnU’s new president, Christopher Roberts. Having been with the university since 1994, Chris is well equipped to take on this role. I wish him all the best as he leads #Auburn’s faculty and students to new horizons and continued excellence.

Jelena McWilliams, a former trusted adviser and Chief Counsel for the U.S. Senate Banking Committee, served an exceptional tenure as Chairman of the @FDICgov. My full statement: https://t.co/fG7AFr3qYj

Cogongrass is a harmful invasive species that has been spreading across AL’s native vegetation. I'm pleased there is a program in place to assist landowners in mitigating the damaging effects cogongrass has inflicted on private land in Alabama. Read more: https://t.co/pO2UqEfIBJ

I am grateful for @DeltaRegional's continued support for sound investments in #Alabama’s water infrastructure. I look forward to the lasting, various benefits that this $3.4M will have on our state’s economy and the day-to-day lives of residents who call the Black Belt home. https://t.co/pwvUGhu53U

The LMXT is yet another opportunity to demonstrate Alabama's staunch devotion to the warfighter. #Alabama knows aerospace, and I trust @Airbus and @LockheedMartin to harness the talent Mobile has to offer to deliver the product our @usairforce deserves. https://t.co/wZoq3heddF

I commend @Airbus and @LockheedMartin for continuing to recognize AL’s commitment to excellence in manufacturing & engineering. Our state's workforce produces world-class products that serve to strengthen national security and maintain military readiness. https://t.co/wZoq3heddF https://t.co/55I1DL7yca

The University of Alabama at Birmingham was among the winners of @US_EDA's #STEMTallentChallenge. @UABNews was awarded $219K to bring students & data professionals together to work on real-world data analysis and provide students with experience in the health technology sector. https://t.co/KFtdVH08ma

Enjoyed visiting Redstone Arsenal today and checking out the ongoing construction of the new @FBI facilities. These state-of-the-art buildings right here in Huntsville will help enhance our nation’s cyber capabilities and workforce. Thanks for having me, @TeamRedstone! https://t.co/YR9nGK7yqm

The Holocaust was one of the darkest times in history. We will never forget the 6 million Jewish victims who were senselessly murdered, and we must vow to ensure something like that never happens again. #NeverAgain #HolocaustRemembranceDay

This funding will significantly increase access to health care, education, and public services in rural communities. I will continue to support projects that improve the lives of all Alabamians and appreciate @USDA's support of @medwesthospital's new facility. https://t.co/MFV8Zz5JWY

In order to preserve the unbiased oversight of the banking industry, Congress must protect the independence of the @FDICgov. Proud to cosponsor a bill that would take meaningful action toward restoring public confidence in the FDIC & maintaining its impartial, nonpartisan nature. https://t.co/mJ2ouVkTJu

Very pleased to share that 15 schools in Alabama have been awarded STEM grants from TVA. This funding will provide new and exciting opportunities for teachers and students to learn and help shape the next generation of innovators. @TVAnews https://t.co/DiesBLf3hD

Pleased to join my colleagues in urging the Biden Administration to reverse its unfair national liver distribution policy. As we note in our letter, the liver allocation decision was fundamentally flawed, and the body charged with carrying it out is systematically broken. https://t.co/9llZBANv2J

It's official – Birmingham, Alabama, will serve as the host city for the inaugural @USFL season. The #MagicCity boasts two stadiums, as well as a growing metropolitan area. I look forward to the many economic opportunities that are headed #Birmingham's way. Go @USFLStallions! https://t.co/GwVX13KQYE

For Alabamians living in #ShelbyCounty or #JeffersonCounty who were affected by the severe storms & flooding Oct. 6-7 – the deadline to apply for disaster assistance is Feb. 21, 2022. You can apply by phone, online, & through @FEMA's mobile app. Read more: https://t.co/kjFCBHIMwJ

Very pleased that @USGS has chosen to partner with the @UofAlabama to relocate its Hydrologic Instrumentation Facility to Alabama. The University of Alabama is a leading innovator in the field of water research and science. This is excellent news.
https://t.co/eXdk7kS6e2

It’s always a pleasure to engage in a friendly wager with my fellow Republican colleague, @senrobportman -- especially when the Tide comes out on top. Cincinnati’s @GoBearcatsFB gave it a good run, but now it’s Graeter’s ice cream time. Thanks for being a great sport, Rob! https://t.co/F47KPONmzy

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was a true visionary. His character and fortitude while paving the way for equality set him apart as one of our nation’s greatest leaders. His legacy will continue to impact countless lives for years to come. #MLKDay
While January 6, 2021, was a dark day for our country, law and order was established and we continue to stand strong. I am confident that justice will be served to those who broke the law.

One year after the attack on the US Capitol, I remain grateful for @CapitolPolice & other brave law enforcement officers & National Guardsmen who protected us & defended our democracy. In all my years, I never thought that would happen in America. I hope it never happens again.

This afternoon @AlabamaFTBL will take on @GoBearcatsFB in the #CottonBowl! Ahead of today's big game, @senrobportman and I decided to place a friendly wager. Alabama's Priester's Pecans and Graeter's ice cream are on the line. Looking forward to enjoying some ice cream. #RollTide https://t.co/68B70dATg4

My wife, Annette, and I were saddened to learn of the death of Senator Reid this afternoon. Harry and I were long-term friends. Even though we had different political philosophies, we served respectfully alongside one another. My full statement: https://t.co/aSNHbhG2JA
Wishing you all a very merry Christmas today. I hope everyone is enjoying this time surrounded by good friends and family. Have a wonderful holiday season. https://t.co/1NpNj6dx4q

I want to thank former longtime @BankingGOP counsel & @SECGov Commissioner Elad Roisman for his yrs of service. Elad has served an important role in supporting & enhancing our nation’s financial system. I urge @POTUS to swiftly nominate a likeminded conservative to fill his seat.

Sad to learn of the passing of my friend & former colleague from Georgia, Sen. Johnny Isakson. Johnny’s integrity, support for our veterans, & determination to find solutions will forever be part of his legacy. Annette & I send our condolences to his wife, Dianne, & their family.

After months of delay by Senate Democrats, I am pleased we have finally passed a defense authorization bill. But the promises in this bill are meaningless without enactment of a defense appropriations bill for FY22. My full statement: https://t.co/vgQUoExumx

Happy 202nd birthday, #Alabama! #OTD in 1819, Alabama joined the union & became a state. Alabama has since been home to prospering businesses, prestigious schools, nationally-renowned health centers, & an affordable housing market. I'm privileged to represent this great state.

Whether it's protecting Americans here at home or overseas, the @NationalGuard has worked diligently to keep us safe for 385 years. Happy birthday to the nation's longest-standing military organization and the fighting force that is our National Guard. #Guard385 https://t.co/zI2zjDUPwr
I urge Republicans and Democrats to denounce this blatant attack on the independence and integrity of the @FDICgov. https://t.co/twBAKwQGSb

For 88 years, the @FDICgov has served a vital role in protecting our financial system. @ChopraCFPB’s unprecedented actions to circumvent Chairman McWilliams aim to politicize a historically bipartisan FDIC board and threaten the productive operation & impartiality of the agency.

I agree with @SecDef, which is why I hope Dems in the House & Senate will reinstate the Shelby-Leahy process that resulted in the Pentagon getting its only on-time budget in the last decade. Time is wasting & our brave men & women in uniform shouldn’t be pawns in a partisan game. https://t.co/I2Atbe8M5G

As I’ve said before, President Biden’s vaccine mandate violates our constitutional liberties and is federal overreach at its finest. Today I was proud to vote for @SenatorBraun's CRA to overturn that mandate. https://t.co/vlUGyiNZk2

.@TheJusticeDept @OJPNIJ has awarded the @UofAlabama, in partnership with ADFS and @AlabamaDAA, $4 million for the development of a National Center on Forensics, one of the first of its kind in the United States. This is outstanding news. More info: https://t.co/GrO9OQ4mbK

I advocated early on that Saule Omarova withdraw her nomination, and I am very relieved to learn that she has done so. Her views are far too radical for someone nominated to serve as our nation’s top banking regulator.

Today marks 80 years since our nation suffered a devastating attack on #PearlHarbor. More than 2,400 Americans made the ultimate sacrifice that fateful day in 1941. Let us never forget their courage, and may we forever honor the Greatest Generation. https://t.co/O1dd8YVidd

Congratulations to @ulalaunch on their most recent success, the 90th launch of the Atlas V Rocket! To date, ULA has launched 147 times, and they boast an impressive 100% mission success rate. This is excellent news and enhances our nation's warfighting capabilities. https://t.co/IFY826yZYB

Today @SenTuberville and I, along with many of our House colleagues from Alabama, introduced a resolution to honor the 100th anniversary of @AlfaFarmers – a group who has led the charge as a clear and united voice for our state’s agriculture industry. https://t.co/4q6LtY810U
I am very saddened to learn of the passing of Bob Dole, who left an indelible impact on our nation. He was a close friend and mentor to me in the Senate. My full statement: https://t.co/Ip89Wb7pEH

Despite the crisis at our southern border, President Biden wants to provide illegal immigrants cash settlements at the cost of American taxpayers. I am proud to cosponsor legislation that would prevent the Administration from making such an egregious mistake. https://t.co/vM4cM0ZwMr

Congratulations to @UofAlabama’s Nicholas Hayes, who was recently recognized as a Rhodes Scholar – one of only 32 this year. This is a prestigious honor. I’m proud to see an Alabama student has risen to the occasion and am confident Mr. Hayes will excel at @UniofOxford in 2022. https://t.co/5CrfLYDaXx

Happy #Thanksgiving! Today and every day I am thankful for our servicemen and women who work tirelessly to keep us safe. Our troops are the reason we, as a nation, can enjoy our freedoms and spend time with friends and family. https://t.co/1e8pH4ejKX

This $32M @USDA investment is excellent news for local meat & poultry processors. Proud to see that $1.14M of this is heading to facilities in Alabama. These grants will help smaller businesses compete in the marketplace and expand important food supply chain operations. https://t.co/SwfUnyYIHZ

As the longest serving member and former chairman of the Senate Banking Committee, I understand the importance of the role the Comptroller of the Currency serves in regulating and supervising national banks. Dr. Omarova is not qualified for this position.

After reviewing Dr. Omarova’s record and hearing her testimony today, I have grave concerns about her views and ability to lead the OCC in an impartial manner. I will not support her nomination. @BankingGOP

This is excellent news for UAB and patient care in #Alabama. I look forward to seeing the positive impacts this cutting-edge facility will have on the day to day lives of Alabamians and the local economy. https://t.co/5sqYio1PwY

The crisis at our southern border continues. Meanwhile, Democrats want to pay $450,000 to illegal immigrants who were subjected to the zero-tolerance policy. By contrast, when a soldier is killed on active duty, their family receives $100,000. This is an insult to all Americans.

Today I met with @federalreserve Chair Jay Powell. We discussed his potential renomination, monetary policy, supply chain issues, and inflation, which I believe is his biggest challenge. I’m deeply concerned that inflation is already with us and that the Fed has missed the boat.

I am very pleased that @USDOT has awarded Alabama two RAISE grants, which total $18.5 million, for local infrastructure improvements. These are worthy projects that support increased safety and economic growth opportunity for communities in our state. https://t.co/8yjS1s0C1C
His devotion to our nation and his state merits praise. I thank Pat for his friendship and wish he and his wife, Marcelle, all the best. 2/2 https://t.co/tXvbpucRAI

Over the past 47 years, Chairman Leahy has had a remarkable career in the Senate. As chairman of the Appropriations, Judiciary, and Agriculture committees and president pro tempore of the Senate, Pat has served Vermont well and with honor. 1/2 https://t.co/tXvbpucRAI

Our veterans put their lives on the line to protect our freedoms, placing the needs of our nation above their own. We are forever indebted to all American soldiers who answered the call to serve. Their bravery and selfless sacrifice will not be forgotten. #VeteransDay https://t.co/wO2VgwDNCf

Very pleased that the new Air Traffic Control Tower for the Gulf Shores JKA Airport has officially been completed. This is great for the #GulfShores area and will contribute to increased economic development opportunities for our state. https://t.co/PqwZl2saDM

For 246 years, the brave men and women of the #Marines have fought to protect our liberties and proven their fortitude every step of the way. Today and everyday, we are grateful for their unwavering commitment. Happy birthday to our @USMC! #SemperFi
Pleased to see that former Congressman Jo Bonner will serve as the @UofSouthAlabama’s fourth president. I look forward to what the future holds for USA with Jo at the helm. https://t.co/WhSKzxPgyY
While I urge people to consult with their doctor about getting vaccinated, I believe our individual freedoms and rights are of the utmost importance.

Last week I proudly joined @SenatorBraun and other @SenateGOP colleagues in officially challenging President Biden’s vaccine mandate under the Congressional Review Act. This mandate violates our constitutional liberties and is federal overreach at its finest.

I hope that these materials will facilitate academic research for scholars and students of law, history, policy, political science & other fields, as I believe one of the most important investments we make is in our classrooms. Thank you, @UofAlabama, for this gracious effort.

I'm honored to donate my official papers to the @UofAlabama once my season in Congress comes to an end. I've been fortunate to serve the ppl of AL for more than 40yrs & cannot think of a more appropriate place to house my official papers than my alma mater.https://t.co/k5XCN1Qhop

Today I made an offer to negotiate on numbers & substance if we return to the Shelby-Leahy agreement (retain legacy riders & jettison poison pills). Pelosi & Schumer supported this model when Dems were in the minority. It is what worked then and what will work for FY22 bills. https://t.co/8nJzwDmpVB https://t.co/uynDaLfLde

Today I’d like to thank first responders everywhere. These men and women are the first to arrive and take action at the scene of a disaster – putting their lives on the line for the safety of others. I commend their bravery and willingness to serve. #NationalFirstRespondersDay

Afterschool programs keep kids safe, inspire them to learn and grow, and give parents peace of mind. Proud to see communities across Alabama celebrating these programs with @ALACNAlabama. #LightsOnAfterschool https://t.co/XjyCzU7tOr

Last week, Alabama received a total of $2.35 million in Distance, Learning & Telemedicine grants from @USDA. These investments will help increase access to quality healthcare and educational services. Great news for rural areas throughout the state. https://t.co/pAVPidhyo8

The Biden administration’s misguided plan to let the IRS monitor law-abiding citizens’ private financial information is dangerous and invasive, and will have far-reaching, adverse consequences. This should concern all Americans who value their privacy. https://t.co/HQeRM4q4pq

I am honored to receive the Dredging Contractors of America’s distinguished Lifetime Achievement Award. Throughout my tenure in Congress, I have worked to improve maritime infrastructure and prioritize #dredging needs, creating the conditions for a more robust maritime industry. https://t.co/JQ5dagOOrq
A trailblazer on his own accord, General Powell served our nation with integrity, courage, and devotion. He will never be forgotten.

My thoughts and prayers are with the family and friends of Colin Powell, the four-star Army General and former Secretary of State, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and National Security Advisor. The entire nation mourns the loss of this statesman.

For over two centuries, America's Navy has worked diligently day in and day out to protect our nation's interests at home and at sea. I am proud to recognize their service, sacrifice, and unwavering commitment. Happy 246th birthday, @USNavy! https://t.co/zxeAOrrUOc

Happy #NationalFarmersDay to the hard-working men and women who devote their lives to feeding and fueling the world. Alabama's farmers are indispensable to our state's economy, and I am grateful for their dedication, grit, and resilient nature. Thank you, farmers!

Congratulations to @Austal_USA on the $145M @USNavy contract to build steel towing & salvage ships. This speaks volumes about Alabama’s premier workforce & dedication to improving our defense forces through innovative shipbuilding. Great news for Alabama! https://t.co/lI3SThHUgQ

We’ve been fortunate to benefit from Dr. Collins’ leadership, particularly during a time when smart, sensible public health policies are critical to our success. I thank Dr. Collins for his incredible influence and wisdom. He will certainly be missed. https://t.co/G7LG3ahJhI

Dr. Francis Collins is the most impactful and respected @NIHDirector our nation has ever seen. Having devoted nearly three decades to NIH, his investment in medical research and close partnership with research universities have resulted in a host of advanced medical capabilities.

Today I attended a ribbon cutting ceremony for @LockheedMartin’s new Hypersonic Missile Assembly Building located in Courtland, #Alabama. This world-class production facility will help advance our nation’s defense capabilities and further develop AL's national security footprint. https://t.co/yyPoFYcbuM

I joined @SenJohnThune & colleagues in opposing Biden’s proposal to require financial institutions to report confidential information to the IRS - compromising American taxpayers' privacy & unnecessarily burdening financial institutions across the nation. https://t.co/j8GBnP1sK9

Our CR, S.2789, keeps the government open, provides much needed disaster assistance to storm-ravaged areas of our country, and delivers the aid necessary to address the Afghanistan withdrawal crisis. https://t.co/XgmC0MF1KM

Just now, I spoke on the Senate floor to urge my Democratic colleagues to take up and pass a bipartisan CR package. @LeaderMcConnell & I introduced a clean CR that was negotiated on a bipartisan, bicameral basis and has support on both sides of the aisle. https://t.co/XgmC0MF1KM

Importantly, our bill includes funding for the Iron Dome, making good on our commitment to a historic & significant ally, and it removes Dems’ ill-conceived language on the debt limit. Members on both sides of the aisle can support this measure, & I urge them to do so with haste.

.@LeaderMcConnell and I have introduced a CR package that would extend government funding, provide much-needed disaster relief, and deliver targeted Afghan assistance – tackling our most urgent priorities. https://t.co/OGsvVKZFXR

Five Alabama schools have been awarded a @NatlBlueRibbon, @usedgov's highest honor – Brewton Elementary, Hall-Kent Elementary, MacMillan International Academy, Mt. Laurel Elementary, and Orange Beach Elementary. I applaud their commitment to excellence! https://t.co/DY1iaitewm
Local communities will be directly impacted by this airport grant funding, which will help improve the quality of life for residents, increase tourism, and drive development. https://t.co/TiDbkgo8t7

I am proud that the @USDOT is granting $4.3M in FAA funding to enhance the development of our airport infrastructure. These grants are important investments in the safety, efficiency, and expansion of large and small airports around our state. @FAANews https://t.co/TiDbkgo8t7

Two high school students will be chosen to represent #Alabama in this prestigious program. Each delegate will hear major policy addresses, participate in high-profile meetings, and receive a $10K scholarship for undergraduate studies. The deadline to apply is September 30, 2021.

The U.S. @SenateYouth Program plans to return to DC for their 60th Annual Washington Week in early March. This is an invaluable learning opportunity for young Alabamians to gain a greater understanding of their national government. Click here to apply: https://t.co/zpyDodVv2s

ICYMI: Mountain Brook's very own, Jane Grey Battle, earned a spot on the 2021-22 USA Debate Team! The young competitor is the first Alabamian in history to qualify for the team. I’m confident that she will represent our state well as she competes internationally. https://t.co/jmaCSxeGrb
May we remember and honor the innocent lives taken, and may September 11th forever serve as a testament to the courage and resilience of the American people. #NeverForget  https://t.co/OeSsOVjgFp

Their sacrifice is a reminder that our freedoms and liberties must not be taken for granted. Twenty years later, our nation is stronger and more grounded in the American values and principles under attack that dreadful day.

I remember the chaos that ensued that day in our nation’s Capitol, and the tragedy that engulfed the entire country as a result of the barbaric acts of terrorists. Thousands of heroes paid the ultimate price.
Today marks 20 years since our country fell under attack on September 11, 2001 — a day that changed the course of our nation’s history. #NeverForget  https://t.co/OeSsOVjgFp

The Tennessee Valley Authority's #STEM Classroom Grant Program is back and accepting applications through October 18. This is an excellent opportunity for K-12 schools within the Tennessee Valley region. Visit the @TVAnews link below for further information and to apply. https://t.co/CpgFk2E1GW

Happy #LaborDay, a day in which we celebrate the strength and resilience of America’s workforce. My wife, Annette, and I hope everyone is staying safe and enjoying the long weekend. https://t.co/gBpJH02Mpr

Alabama’s own Dr. Clayton Yates of @TuskegeeUniv has been featured by @theNCI, where they highlighted his impressive and ambitious cancer research journey. Dr. Yates has committed his life to cancer disparities research and achieving health equity. https://t.co/SX4kiSTtoM
Please be safe, cautious, and prepared as Hurricane Ida approaches the Gulf Coast. https://t.co/S8wGKqhuRL

Good news for #GulfCoast anglers: @UofSouthAlabama & @AuburnU will participate in the Greater Amberjack Abundance Study & receive grant funding. AL scientists & researchers are leaders in reef fish mgmt & I'm confident that the project will be successful due to their involvement. https://t.co/KTtTRXXxlY

Deeply saddened by the attacks today in Kabul and the many U.S. servicemembers killed while heroically working to protect our citizens and allies. Praying for their families and loved ones during this time of tragedy, and for the safety of our forces still on the ground in Kabul.

The @US_EDA has granted the @UofSouthAlabama $644K to renovate it’s Laboratory for Additive Manufacturing and provide further resources for a well-trained workforce. This is excellent news for the future of cyber manufacturing in Alabama!
https://t.co/bD8rYE6FQU

The situation in Afghanistan is a complete disaster. After 20 years and billions of dollars in training and support for the Afghan army, we need to seriously scrutinize why the Afghan military fell apart so quickly. The world is watching.

Congratulations to HMMA on their most recent milestone of producing 5 million vehicles out of #Montgomery, Alabama! This is excellent news and a strong indicator of our state's success in the automotive industry. I look forward to seeing what they will accomplish next. #MadeinAL https://t.co/nOjx6bgJvL

This is a significant step in our work to bring a long-awaited, new federal courthouse to Huntsville — a priority of mine for years. In 2018, I worked to secure $110M in funding for this project. I look forward to the lasting impact it will have in North Alabama & its completion. https://t.co/MMXtohXxB3

Dems are all too willing to neglect our defense infrastructure needs while spending hand over fist on their liberal wish list. This reflexive neglect for our national security & the millions of jobs that support it is reckless. It must stop. I hope my colleagues support my amdt.

Will my Democratic colleagues now support this multi-trillion dollar social spending binge while continuing to turn a blind eye to the military infrastructure needs in their own states? I certainly hope not.
My Democratic colleagues inexplicably blocked a vote on a related defense infrastructure amendment in the infrastructure bill that just passed the Senate. Now it’s time to stand and be counted.

We're responsible for providing our Armed Forces what they need to protect us. My amdt helps accomplish that. We’re talking about supporting projects in Alabama, Arizona, Georgia, Virginia, Rhode Island, Connecticut, Maine, California, Hawaii, Maryland, Nevada, New Mexico & more.

We need to modernize shipyards, test ranges, depots, & ammunition plants; install 5G technology at military bases; support our nuclear defense infrastructure; & so much more. These infrastructure projects are absolutely critical to our national security & impact millions of jobs.

The Senate is now voting on my defense infrastructure amendment to Democrats’ so-called budget proposal. This amendment, which I introduced with @JimInhofe and @SenatorWicker, provides $50.2 billion to meet defense infrastructure needs across this nation.
If Senate Democrats continue to prioritize a reckless social spending spree and ignore the needs of our Armed Forces, the future of this country will be in jeopardy. https://t.co/mA91U8awg4

Supporting trillions of taxpayer dollars for other infrastructure & social programs without investing in our national defense is shameful & inexcusable. We are responsible for providing our men & women in uniform what they need to protect us, and this amdt helps accomplish that.

Democrats are all too willing to neglect our defense infrastructure needs while spending hand over fist on their liberal wish list. This so-called budget proposal is yet another example of that. https://t.co/e7YFnoRUU5

I supported @SenToomey cryptocurrency amdt. I know of its importance to innovation & job creation, but I believe it pales in comparison to the security of our nation–which is why I called for a vote on my defense infrastructure amdt. It's unfortunate that Dems blocked both amdts.
For America to remain strong and prosperous, we must balance funding for the domestic and defense priorities of this nation. https://t.co/YjS0jPEBnY
There is a clear and dangerous pattern here. The recklessness of the Democrats’ domestic spending spree is matched only by their neglect for America’s military. It must stop.

This comes on the heels of legislation they claim will combat Chinese aggression but also includes nothing for our military. And now the Democrats are turning to a $3.5 trillion budget that will finance their liberal wish list but drastically shortchange our military once again.

It is shameful that this massive infrastructure legislation contains not one dime for our military’s vast infrastructure needs. Not only that, Senate Democrats blocked every attempt to fix this glaring omission.  https://t.co/YjS0jPEBnY

Today @JimInhofe, @SenatorWicker, & I highlighted our concerns with the lack of resources for military infrastructure in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act. Our nation’s defense infrastructure needs were ignored in this massive infrastructure bill. https://t.co/UAmr1WCP67
I would hope that this would not interfere with our work to grow the Port of Mobile and transform Mobile into one of the top multi-modal transit hubs in the United States. https://t.co/LqD784qnQV

STB’s recent decision calls for further consideration of new passenger rail service on the Gulf Coast. I continue to believe the forthcoming decision should be guided by data, including studies on the service’s impact on economic development & jobs in & around the Port of Mobile.

Sending condolences to the family, friends, & colleagues of Snr. Officer George Gonzalez who lost his life in the line of duty on Tuesday. Officer Gonzalez served in the @PFPAOfficial for the past three years, and before that overseas in Iraq. His sacrifice will not be forgotten.

Today we celebrate 231 years of the @USCG! The men and women of the Coast Guard play a large role in defending and protecting Alabama's shores and beyond. I am grateful for their dedicated service and commitment to our safety. #SemperParatus #AlwaysReady https://t.co/44DAVzryZW

Today, my colleagues and I on the Appropriations Committee advanced three important bills that contain funding for #Alabama priorities, including resources for water infrastructure projects, farmers in rural communities, and assistance for our veterans.  https://t.co/7lExGFyF0a

.@NSF has awarded @AuburnU $10M to lead the Southeastern region in a collaborative research project to increase the number of disabled students who complete STEM degrees and enter the respective workforce. This is a national initiative, and I am proud to see Auburn at the helm.

@NSF has awarded @AuburnU $10M to lead the Southeastern region in a collaborative research project to increase the number of disabled students who complete STEM degrees and enter the respective workforce. This is a national initiative, and I am proud to see Auburn at the helm.

Senator Carl Levin was an honest man who devoted most of his life to his home state of Michigan, where he was the longest-serving senator in history. A two-time chairman of the Armed Services Committee, he prioritized our national security. We send our condolences to his family.
I urge members of the House to quickly take up this important security supplemental legislation and send it to @POTUS’s desk without further delay.

It’s past time we provide urgently-needed funding to safeguard the Capitol, ensure @USNationalGuard readiness, and protect our allies in Afghanistan. I am pleased the Senate has advanced this bipartisan bill 98-0 to fund our immediate security needs. https://t.co/I3wdly7BJU
